node.text:
• • • • •
We teased you yesterday, but no more monkeying around…here’s the recipe for Monkey Punch!

This tasty cocktail recipe has been created by Erik Lorincz from Kwānt, No.47 in The World’s 50 Best Bars 2019, with Monkey Shoulder whisky. Will you be giving it a try?

𝐈𝐧𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬
25ml Monkey Shoulder
25ml Calvados
10ml Mezcal
10ml oloroso sherry
50ml oat milk
5g zatar
15g demerara sugar 
Garnished with floregano •
Video by @50bestbars
#tw50bc #theworlds50bestcocktails
#Worlds50BestBars #50BestBars #Cocktail #Bar #London #Recipe #CocktailRecipe #Bartender #UK #whisky @monkeyshoulder @kwantlondon @eriklorincz

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @your_modern_bartender 

𝗣𝗥𝗔𝗟𝗜𝗡𝗘 𝗢𝗟𝗗 𝗙𝗔𝗦𝗛𝗜𝗢𝗡𝗘𝗗🍸
(English Below) 

FR 🇨🇵 

Après quelques jours de congé bien mérité, on reprend les cocktails 

Dans cette version du Old fashioned, j'ai voulu le transformer en after-dinner cocktail. Avec ce rhum au arômes de chocolat associé à la liqueur de  café, au sirop et au bitter, une vraie praline s'est construite ! 

Santé !
.
• 50ml Rhum brun bio @gran_chaco_ron
• 10ml Liqueur de café @timariadrink
• 10ml Sirop de chocolat blanc @1883syrups
• 2 traits Angostura @angosturahouse
• 2 traits chocolat bitters @scrappysbitters 

𝗠é𝘁𝗵𝗼𝗱𝗲 : Direct 

𝗗é𝗰𝗼𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 : Praline 

Clear ice @icelander_be 

•••••••••••••••••••• 

EN 🇬🇧 

After a few well-deserved days off, we resume cocktails 

In this version of Old fashioned, I wanted to transform it into an after-dinner cocktail. With this rum with chocolate aromas associated with coffee liqueur, syrup and bitter, a real praline has been built! 

Cheers ! 

• 50ml Brown rum 100% organic @gran_chaco_ron
• 10ml Coffee liqueur @timariadrink
• 10ml White chocolate syrup @1883syrups
• 2 traits Angostura @angosturahouse
• 2 traits chocolate bitter @scrappysbitters 

𝗠𝗲𝘁𝗵𝗼𝗱 : Build over ice 

𝗚𝗮𝗿𝗻𝗶𝘀𝗵 : Praline 

Clear ice @icelander_be 

𝑻𝒆𝒍𝒍 𝒖𝒔 𝒘𝒉𝒂𝒕 𝒚𝒐𝒖 𝒕𝒉𝒊𝒏𝒌 𝒊𝒏 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒄𝒐𝒎𝒎𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒔 ⬇️ 
============================

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @thehobbydrinkchef 

We’re back with another instalment of #soundtrackmyfriendsdrink - the community challenge hosted by Adam @soundtrackmydrink - and for the fourth edition, we’re honouring musicians that have passed away. 

I was assigned the song ‘Needled 24/7’ by Children of Bodom from @denisgor . This Finish heavy metal band was fronted by Alexi Laiho, an absolutely amazing guitarist. When I was younger, and much much better at guitar than I am these days, Alexi was definitely viewed as one of the best guitarists, and I was never even close to being able to pull off any of his songs. Unfortunately he passed away earlier this year at the age of 41. Even more unfortunate is that he died of liver degeneration due to years of alcohol abuse. Dam. How do you make a drink to honour someone who literally died from drinking? Well… you try really hard to use no alcohol! I also chose to incorporate a few ingredients that have proven health benefits for improving liver function, something that we should all be mindful of, given the niche that we’re in. 

The song itself speaks about betrayal, being “burned” way too many times. So yeah, we had to do some fire elements for this one, and while we’re at it, why not just make it a black cocktail, the song and band are pretty dark, after all! 

CATCHING FIRE
2oz Seedlip Grove 42
3/4oz Matcha Green Tea Syrup
3/4oz grapefruit juice
1/2oz lime juice 
2 dashes of hot pepper bitters
1 barspoon of agave syrup
1 barspoon activated charcoal 
Absinthe for flames 

Rim a rocks glass with sea salt/black lava salt and set aside. Add all ingredients to a shaker tin with ice and shake. Strain into the rocks glass over fresh ice, then garnish with the spent lime. Add a sugar cube soaked with absinthe, set on fire, and sprinkle with cinnamon to let the flames go wild!! *watch the eyebrows*

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @cheerstohappyhour 

(Recipe Included) - Last week I mentioned I have invited Toronto Bartenders to create some tasty sippers using the bold, extra smooth and brand new, @renpremiumvodka. This beauty was created by Blake Canning (aka @thebitterendbar) and is just class in a glass - something special for those who like to fill their vessel with a hint of terroir.
.
Creators Notes: The lemon grapefruit vermouth accentuates the citrus, and just a barspoon of gentian creates a nice follow through of subtle earthy bitterness.
.
Drink: Northern Terroir Martini
Recipe by: @thebitterendbar
2 oz Ren Vodka
0.5 oz lemon/grapefruit infused dry vermouth
0.5 oz Gentian
Topped with Sweet Corn Air*
.
(Method)
Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a Martini glass. Garnish: Sweet Corn Foam.
.
*Sweet Corn Air
Blend about 400ml and strain into a bowl so it has the same consistency as juice. Add a dash of Soy Lecithin and Blend again using an immersion blender (one of those handheld electric blenders with the blades on the end), holding the blender half in and half out of the liquid. The foam starts to build

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @ebbydranks 

Dear tequila and mezcal, bring me closer to the agave gods. I need you on this Thursday to give me the strength I need to limp to the weekend. Your faithful servant, Ebby. 

I love spicy food. Going in. You know where this is going. The butt is a vital organ. Sidebar, not every exit is an entrance. Specifically about food. Maybe only about food. Get your mind out of the gutter. Where mine is. Glad we got that straight. SO HOW IS EVERYONE DOING? Good? Me too. This drink is delicious, smoky, and got a kick that'll make every orifice pucker. 

Mezcal Sun-Rita 

0.75 oz blanco tequila (@bluenectartequila)
0.75 oz mezcal (@kimosabemezcal)
0.25 oz hibiscus ginger syrup (@boozybotanicals)
0.25 oz habanero tincture
4 oz orange juice
1.5 oz lime juice 

Combine all ingredients (except the hibiscus ginger syrup) in a collins glass. Top it off with pebble ice. Drizzle/jizzle the hibiscus syrup on top for a cool effect. Drop in a gorgeous glass straw (@surfsidesips - EBBY20 for 20% off). Garnish with a dried hibiscus flower. 

This August, I'll be working with @surfsidesips and @humanesociety. The Humane Society of the United States fights the big fights to end suffering for all animals, not just dogs and cats. They work to stop large-scale cruelty such as cosmetics animal testing, fur and factory farming, trophy hunting and puppy mills. Along with their supporters and volunteers, they work to pass anti-cruelty laws, promote humane eating, help animals in captivity and bring veterinary services to pets in underserved communities. So let's come together to protect and provide care for creatures who can't.

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @jason_._holmes 

Today’s cocktail is truly fascinating. A subtle variation on Sother Teague’s (Amor Y Amargo, New York) ‘Sharpie Mustache’. This pairing is nothing short of brilliant.
.
Who would think to partner gin and rye whiskey? Let alone in equal proportions. It works!
After consuming this stirred delight I’m further of the mindset that Bonal just makes everything better. A healthy dose of Meletti certainly assists with those endeavors, as well.
Get to mixing and whip up one of these numbers — you won’t regret it. I bet you’ll be just as surprised at how well these ingredients collaborate together! Cheers!
 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
_____________________
CITRUS MUSTACHE
3/4 oz Plymouth Gin—
3/4 oz Rye Whiskey—
3/4 oz Bonal Gentiane-Quina—
3/4 oz Amaro Meletti—
2 dashes Wormwood bitters—
Garnish with grapefruit peel ‘mustache’.
 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
_____________________

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @thecocktail.blog 

🌱
(annonce/MILD & FLORAL)
🌱
In need of a Mild and Floral sipping sensation?
🌱
Then I'm confident todays treat will suit you just nicely
🌱
The base being as Gentle(man) as can be, full of potent botanicals and juniper notes, the scene is set for a nice sitting in the Sun
🌱
I gently added some mild fruity flavors consisting of blueberries and lemongrass, combined with the floral Rose Petals, it added just enough of that Mild and Floral complexity I was seeking for todays sipping moment
🌱
Fresh and crisp bitters as well as tonic, made sure the glass was never emptied and re-fills did occur
🌱
A GENT'LY ROSE
🌱
5 cl Gin (@gentlemans_gin )
0.5 cl Blueberry & Lemongrass Liqueur (@kokorogin )
0.5 cl Rose Petal Liqueur (@laniquedrinks )
2 Dashes Lemon Bitters (@thebittertruthcompany )
Stir directly in the glass over plenty ice 🧊
Add more ice 🧊
Top with crisp Tonic Water (@ginput_dk )
Garnish with Greens 🥬of the Day
Enjoy🔱
Skål🥂
- - - - -

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @servedbysoberon 

Diffords Top 100: BROOKLYN (68/100)
- 45ml/1.5oz Rye Whiskey
- 45ml/1.5oz Dry Vermouth
- 10ml/0.33oz Picon
- 10ml/0.33oz Maraschino
- - - - -
HOW: Stir with ice / Strain in coupe / Garnish.
- - -
RATING: 3.5/5
- - - - -
The Brooklyn first appeared in print in 1908 and is part of the legendary set of cocktails named after one of New York's boroughs.🗽 At its core it's a Manhattan Riff, yet utilizes 2 important modifiers to set it apart: Amer Picon & Maraschino 🍒.
.
Initially, the cocktail was created with a base of equal parts Rye and Sweet Vermouth 🍷 to evolve into the more common '2 parts Rye to 1 part Dry Vermouth' version.🥃 Ultimately, Simon Difford settles with a preferred ratio of equal parts 'Rye & Dry' ⚖️.
.
The Brooklyn (whichever Vermouth you're using) is a pretty good drink, but the Amer Picon is... Eh, dare I say useless?🤷‍♀️ Not only is it nearly impossible to get in the US 🇺🇸 the current bottling also doesn't taste anything like it used to (and just isn't that exciting 🤭).
.
I'd urge anyone interested in this drink to just recreate Chad Solomon's far more superior variation: the 'Bensonhurst' (Milk & Honey, 2006 🍹), which uses 1.5oz Rye to 1oz Dry Vermouth, and is modified with Cynar rather than Picon 👏.
.
Drinkstagram ❤️ what is your favorite of the Boroughs cocktails?
- - - - -

Today I’m heading to @lyanessbar for the bar’s Sunday Lyan series in collaboration with @fevertreemixers and I’m pretty stoked for it 🤙🏽. 

The special menu will feature cocktails inspired by Roasted Kelp, Spruce, and Meadowsweet with partner @askival_rum from Scotland being the focus for drinks 🍹. It’ll be a quintessential Lyan cocktail experience and I’m very much here for it (I’ll review and share some of the drinks from the event in the next week or so).

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @theweekendmixologist

T A I  D U  M A I
1 oz Cognac
½ oz Overproof Rum
1 oz Fresh Lime Juice
½ oz Pineapple Syrup
¼ oz Orange Liqueur
¼ oz Orgeat
Add all ingredients to a shaking tin and then add a small scoop of pebble ice. Whip shake until the ice has melted and open pour into your glass. Fill with pebble ice and garnish.
-
If I see an amazing Mai tai riff like this one, there’s a slim chance I’m not giving it a whirl. 
.
Recipe spotted on @thewhiskeymcgee
Original Recipe from @roquettesea
